column4: mutio: It's perfectly safe to install both OSs to the same drive.
You've already "formatted" the drive, so you've lost both the original Windows install and the new Ubuntu install?
Yes but I can reinstall them ofc
Do you know if your firmware is UEFI?
No i don?t know. Where can I display it?
It would be somewhere in your motherboard's documentation, and there's probably a way to tell if Windows was installed via UEFI from within Windows but I don't know it.

I would recommend simply installing Ubuntu again, using the guided partitioning rather than setting anything up manually, and come back here if you have problems booting Windows again and we'll get you fixed up.
I did use the guided partitioning thats why Im confused what couldve gone wrong.
It's hard to tell without being able to look at how things ended up after the install. If the same thing happens again, it should be pretty easy for me to figure out why and how to fix it.
Alright thanks for helping, I will install Ubuntu now using the guided partitioning again and come back here if the problem persists.
Can you run boot info script and pastebin the RESULTS.txt which it produces?
I will be gone for a few minutes, but I *will* be back (though possibly from my phone where typing will be slow).
ubottu I cant download the tool because I cant install ndiswrapper
Can you connect via ethernet, or copy boot info script over via a USB drive?
I appreciate your help with my boot problem but I would rather try to figure out why I cant install the ndiswrapper packages first
Ill post RESULTS.txt as soon as I got my internet to work
OK. I will be in and out for the next few hours.
